abstract: The second annual “Idol Gives Back” telethon lifted Fox to No. 1 in the ratings on Wednesday, but far fewer viewers tuned in this year than last year to the celebrity-studded charity drive. According to Nielsen’s estimates, the prime time portion of the “American Idol” special, which began its broadcast at 7:30 p.m., attracted 17.6 million viewers from 8 to 10 p.m.
lead_paragraph: The second annual “Idol Gives Back” telethon lifted Fox to No. 1 in the ratings on Wednesday, but far fewer viewers tuned in this year than last year to the celebrity-studded charity drive. According to Nielsen’s estimates, the prime time portion of the “American Idol” special, which began its broadcast at 7:30 p.m., attracted 17.6 million viewers from 8 to 10 p.m.

headline.main: ‘Idol Gives Back,’ But Gives Up Viewers
